alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 10:11PM CDT until September 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding of small streams, ditches, and low areas caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern and eastern Montgomery county in Iowa. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1009 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stanton, Elliott, Grant, Viking Lake State Park and Hacklebarney Woods County Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
